info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 24 at 8:20AM CDT until September 24 at 11:45AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of north central and northwest Louisiana, including the following parishes, in north central Louisiana, Lincoln. In northwest Louisiana, Claiborne.
* WHEN...Until 1145 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 819 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen so far this morning across much of the Advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area through late morning. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Homer, Haynesville, Lisbon, Antioch, Lake Clairborne, Summerfield, Spring Lake, Aycock, Corney Lake, Corinth and Mount Zion. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM CDT THIS MORNING
